pullRequest.body:
- Added the definition of the category FinLinOrd of finite linear ordered sets. 
- Added the definition of the augmented simplex category `AugmentedSimplexCategory`, and showed it is the Skeleton of FinLinOrd.
- Showed that the category of  augmented simplicial objects defined as a comma category is equivalent to the category of functors from `AugmentedSimplexCategory^\op`

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Is this a standard mathematical definition? or do you have foreseen applications of these constructions? Because I am not completely convinced that all of this need to enter mathlib.

In any case, for the equivalence of categories of augmented objects, I would suggest a generalization. Given any category `C` (not just the simplex category), we may define a new category `WithInitial C` whose objects would be either "an object in `C`" or an additional object "zero", and morphisms between objects from `C` are the same, no morphisms to zero (besides the identity), but a single morphism from zero to any object. Then, it seems to me that contravariant functors from this `WithInitial C` would identify to augmented contravariant functors from `C`, and the definitions and proofs should be shorter as we could take advantage of "structural induction" on this type `WithInitial C`. (What I suggest may be trivially wrong! but it seems reasonable to me.)

Hi @joelriou  thanks for your comment, and taking the time to look at it.

To answer your first question of whether it is a standard mathematical definition: Yes it is. See e.g. definition 2.1 of :

- https://ncatlab.org/nlab/show/simplex+category

It is also the category `\Delta_+` in Jacob Lurie's Kerodon site, used e.g. 

https://kerodon.net/tag/04R2

I see two current applications of it:

 1) To define augmented simplicial objects as Lurie does (see the link above) - which is what I also in this pull request. 
 
 2) It can be used to define the join of two simplicial sets (which was my original motivation) 
 
 It is also used in various other places in Lurie's books.
 
Concerning your suggestion about generalising it. I believe your definition only works if one assumes that C does not already have an initial object. So assuming this, probably a better name is `WithStrictInitial C` because the object you are adding is a strict initial object. I agree with your conjecture about contravariant functors.
@joelriou I have done as you suggested with `WithInitial`, making more general theorems and proofs in #10402. I will eventually refactor this pull request to take account of the changes there.

Hey! I don't know too much about simplicial stuff, but this file is certainly within my competence. Would you mind splitting it to a separate PR and request my review there? This would help with moving the current PR forward.

pullRequest.title: feat(AlgebraicTopology): add  Augmented Simplex Category
